title: Wellinger takes gold on normal hill
text:
55 PM / a few seconds ago Wellinger takes gold on normal hill Simon Evans 1 Min Read 
PYEONGCHANG (Reuters) - Germany’s Andreas Wellinger flew through the freezing midnight air to win the gold medal in the men’s normal hill individual ski jumping on Saturday at the Pyeongchang Games. 
Wellinger’s jump of 113.5 meters, earning 259.3 points, beat out Norway’s Johann Andre Forfang with Robert Johannsson, also from Norway, picking up bronze. 
The 22-year-old Wellinger had won gold in the team large hill in Sochi four years ago. Ski Jumping – Pyeongchang 2018 Winter Olympics – Men’s Normal Hill Individual trial round – Alpensia Ski Jumping Centre - Pyeongchang, South Korea – February 10, 2018 - Andreas Wellinger of Germany competes. REUTERS/Carlos Barria 
There was disappointment for Poland’s Kamil Stoch, seeking to become the first man to defend the title, who finished in fourth place. 
Another Pole, Stefan Hula, who had led going into the final round, finished in fifth place. 
Switzerland’s 36-year-old Simon Ammann was unable to add to his record of four individual gold medals and had to settle for 11th place. Reporting by Simon Evans; Editing by Clare Fallon
